page.title: 14HOUSING KIRKBY MALZEARD AREA
page.content: There are 210 houses in Kirkby Malzeard and 142 in Grewelthorpe. Most are built of{limestone}or{sandstone.}A few are{brick.}In Grewelthorpe houses radiate from the church. Most are over 100 years old, some having been converted to modern standards. The majority are 2 storey semi-detached or terraced. Houses in Kirkby line the main street. The older West end has terraced stone property. Both villages have modern semi-detached houses and bungalows. Kirkby has 60%{owner {occupied,}Grewelthorpe has 74%. Rented {Council property}is 23% in Kirkby and 7% in Grewelthorpe. Both villages have {holiday cottages}some of which are purpose built.
